entry.title: Overthinking decisions
entry.body: I keep revisiting the same choice because I don't want to close off options.

outputs.editor:
SUMMARY:
You keep revisiting a decision because you do not want to close off options.
FIXES:
- "revisiting": specify how often you return to it.
- "same choice": name the decision to make it concrete.
- "close off options": clarify which options feel costly to lose.
REWRITE:
I keep revisiting the same decision because I don't want to close off options.
outputs.definer:
KEY TERMS:
- "revisiting": reconsidering the same choice more than once after deciding.
- "close off options": remove paths that cannot be reopened later.
AMBIGUITIES:
- "same choice": could be a single decision or a cluster of related decisions.
- "options": could mean career options or short-term tactics.
BOUNDARIES:
- Not claiming: you lack enough information to decide.
- Not claiming: any option is objectively bad.
outputs.skeptic:
CORE CLAIM:
You delay committing because you want to keep options open.
CHALLENGES:
- "revisiting": this could be indecision caused by unclear criteria rather than attachment to options.
- "close off options": you may be overestimating the permanence of the choice.
- "keep": this could be procrastination framed as optionality, which changes the fix.
TEST:
Write a one-sentence decision rule today and follow it for 7 days.
outputs.coach:
INTENT:
You want to decide without losing important options ("close off options").
OPTIONS:
- Make the decision for 7 days, risking regret. Done looks like acting on one option for a week.
- Define a reversible trial, risking ambiguity. Done looks like a fixed start/end date for the trial.
- List the top two options and pick one by noon tomorrow, risking missed alternatives. Done looks like a written decision.
RECOMMENDATION:
Pick the 7-day decision because it forces movement while keeping time-bounded reversibility. It closes the option of revisiting daily for the next week.
FOR THE NEXT 7 DAYS, STOP:
- Reopening the decision each day
- Seeking new information about other options
